law.catch_line: If a person or governmental unit fails to keep the records required under § 11-504 of this article,...

text.section:
If a person or governmental unit fails to keep the records required under § 11-504 of this article, the Comptroller may:
compute the sales and use tax by using a factor that the Comptroller develops by:
a survey of the business of the person or governmental unit, including any available records;
a survey of other persons or governmental units engaged in the same or similar business; or
other means; and
assess the tax due.

section.section: If a person or governmental unit fails to obtain a proper resale certificate on or before the date stated in a notice of intent to assess the sales and use tax under § 11-408(b) of this article, the Comptroller may assess the sales and use tax on the sale.
An assessment under this subsection is final.
